intro: Anemopaegma racemosum var. brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stalked anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically finely divided. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
